it.polimi.ProgettoIngSW2019.model

Class TurnManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ProgettoIngSW2019.model.TurnManager

  • public class TurnManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manage change of turn, points and keep track of actions left per turn.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TurnManager(GameTable gameTable)
      Constructor that sets the game table, the first player as current player and the number of actions available for the turn of that player

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean assignDoubleKillPoint()
      Assign points for double kill if possible and return true if it is, false otherwise
      Player assignFirstBlood(Player damagedPlayer)
      Assign the extra point for first blood and return the player that got that extra point.
      void changeCurrentPlayer()
      Set the next active player as the 'current player' to refer in this turn and reset the number of actions available.
      java.util.List<Player> checkDeadPlayers()
      At the end of a turn, check if any player has just died and return a list with those players
      void decreaseActionsLeft()
      Decrease the number of actions left to this player for the current turn
      int getActionsLeft()
      Return the number of actions left to the current player for this turn
      Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Return the player whom this turn is
      GameTable getGameTable()
      Return the game table
      Player getPlayerFromCharaName(java.lang.String charaName)
      Convert the name of the character in the actual player if present, throw exception otherwise
      void resetDecksIfNecessary()
      If one of the ammo card deck or the powerup deck is empty, reset that deck using the respective deck of discarded cards.
      int[] scoreDamageLineOf(Player playerToScore)
      Assign points to players after the death of the specified player(the player to score), from his/her damage line, or at the end of the game (in witch every player with damage get scored, even if still alive), except for the points for first blood and double kill
      int[] scoreKillshotTrack()
      Assign points to players from the killshot track at the end of the game and return them in order of player id

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • assignFirstBlood

        public Player assignFirstBlood(Player damagedPlayer)
        Assign the extra point for first blood and return the player that got that extra point. Warning: this method should be called only when you can assign points for first blood.
        Parameters:
        damagedPlayer -
        Returns:
        the player who got points for first blood

      • assignDoubleKillPoint

        public boolean assignDoubleKillPoint()
        Assign points for double kill if possible and return true if it is, false otherwise
        Returns:
        true if there has been a double kill, false otherwise

      • scoreDamageLineOf

        public int[] scoreDamageLineOf(Player playerToScore)
        Assign points to players after the death of the specified player(the player to score), from his/her damage line, or at the end of the game (in witch every player with damage get scored, even if still alive), except for the points for first blood and double kill
        Parameters:
        playerToScore - - killed player to score, or any player at the end of the game
        Returns:
        array of points just assigned to the players in order of id (zero for those who did not receive any points)

      • scoreKillshotTrack

        public int[] scoreKillshotTrack()
        Assign points to players from the killshot track at the end of the game and return them in order of player id
        Returns:
        array of points just assigned to the players in order of id (zero for those who did not receive any points)

      • checkDeadPlayers

        public java.util.List<Player> checkDeadPlayers()
        At the end of a turn, check if any player has just died and return a list with those players
        Returns:
        a list of the players down

      • resetDecksIfNecessary

        public void resetDecksIfNecessary()
        If one of the ammo card deck or the powerup deck is empty, reset that deck using the respective deck of discarded cards.
